column1: Retropharyngeal abscess is a collection of pus in the tissues in the back of the throat.
Retropharyngeal abscess most often affects children under age 5, but it can occur at any age.
The health care provider will perform a physical exam and look inside the throat.
The provider may gently rub the back of the throat with a cotton swab.
Other tests may include: - Complete blood count (CBC) - CT scan of the neck - X-ray of the neck
Corticosteroids are sometimes given to reduce airway swelling.
High-dose antibiotics are given through a vein (intravenous) to treat the infection.
Call your health care provider if you or your child develops a high fever with severe throat pain.
